channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: トランプ氏の裁判にメディアアクセスを提供する交渉の様子。州裁判所システムは、歴史的裁判の準備のために元ジャーナリストのアル・ベイカーを雇った（Charlotte Klein/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Charlotte Klein / Vanity Fair:
A look at the negotiations to provide media access to Trump's trial; the state court system hired ex-journalist Al Baker to prepare for the historic trial  —  For months, reporters, lawyers, and court officials have been negotiating media access to the camera-free proceedings.

item.title: テイラー・スウィフトのTikTokへの復帰は、UMGとそのCEOルシアン・グレインジに対する彼女の力を浮き彫りにした。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Taylor Swift's music returning to TikTok highlights her power over UMG and its CEO Lucian Grainge, who must now hope other music groups join his TikTok fight  —  Shari Redstone believes she's found the right buyer for Paramount.  Her fellow shareholders aren't convinced.

item.title: Ofcomのマイケル・グレード委員長は、テレビがより「搾取的で残酷」になり、それが彼を「狂わせている」と述べ、英国の大衆が今や演者として利用されていることを憂慮している（Richard Brooks/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Richard Brooks / The Guardian:
Ofcom Chair Michael Grade says TV has become more “exploitative and cruel”, which makes him “mad”, and worries that the UK public are now used as performers  —  The boss of the broadcast regulator has expressed concern about how the chase for audience ratings is harming the industry

item.title: Netflixの新映画チーフ、ダン・リンが指揮を執り、同社は観客へのアピールやコスト効率に重点を置いた映画戦略への転換を目指す（Nicole Sperling/New York Times）
item.description:
Nicole Sperling / New York Times:
As Netflix's new film chief Dan Lin takes charge, the company aims to shift its film strategy to focus on audience appeal and cost efficiency  —  Dan Lin, the streaming service's new film chief, wants to produce a more varied slate of movies to better appeal to the array of interests among subscribers.

item.title: マイアミ・ニュース紙とパームビーチ・ポスト紙に漫画を描き、ピューリッツァー賞を2度受賞した社説漫画家のドン・ライト氏が24日、90歳で死去した（サム・ロバーツ／ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
Sam Roberts / New York Times:
Two-time Pulitzer Prize-winning editorial cartoonist Don Wright, who drew cartoons for The Miami News and The Palm Beach Post, died on March 24 at age 90  —  He won two Pulitzers for Florida newspapers, commenting wryly on war, segregation, church scandals and more while reaching readers nationwide through syndication.

item.title: ディズニー・テレビジョン・グループのクレイグ・アーウィッチ社長とのQ&A：HuluからABCへ、ABCの継続的な重要性などについて（Josef Adalian/Vulture）
item.description:
Josef Adalian / Vulture:
Q&A with Craig Erwich, president of Disney Television Group, on determining what shows air where, from Hulu to ABC, the continued importance of ABC, and more  —  This story first ran in Buffering, Vulture's newsletter about the streaming industry.  Head to vulture.com/buffering and subscribe today!

item.title: 3月のデータによると、インターセプトは月30万ドルの赤字で、2025年5月までに資金が底をつく可能性がある。
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
The Intercept is losing ~$300K/month and could run out of cash by May 2025, according to data from March; its CEO says the projection was a worst case scenario  —  The Scoop  —  The Intercept, the left-wing U.S. newsroom that's been a thorn in Joe Biden's side and a hub for pro-Palestinian coverage …

item.title: セマフォー・メディアへようこそ。今週ワシントンD.C.で開催されるセマフォー史上最大のイベント、ワールド・エコノミー・サミットの準備に余念がありません。(ベン・スミス/セマフォー)
item.description:
Ben Smith / Semafor:
Welcome to Semafor Media, where we are frantically gearing up for Semafor's biggest event ever, the World Economy Summit in Washington, D.C., this week.  —  I'll be interviewing Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and Labor Secretary Julie Su.  Liz Hoffman is talking …

item.title: ストリーミングTV各社が第三者の視聴者測定会社とのデータ共有に消極的なため、ブランドがプラットフォームを横断して広告を購入することが難しくなっている（Mike Shields/Next in Media）
item.description:
Mike Shields / Next in Media:
Streaming TV companies' reluctance to share their data with third-party audience measurement firms is making it difficult for brands to buy ads across platforms  —  The TV industry has been on a multi-year quest to make it possible to better measure the audience it delivers for advertisers.

item.title: AP、ABC、FOXなどの報道機関が共同声明を発表、バイデン大統領とトランプ前大統領に選挙前のテレビ討論を行うよう促す（Michael M Grynbaum/New York Times）
item.description:
Michael M. Grynbaum / New York Times:
The AP, ABC, Fox, and other news orgs issue a joint statement urging President Biden and former President Trump to do televised debates ahead of the election  —  In an unusual statement, the news organizations said “there is simply no substitute” for a face-to-face debate, a campaign staple since 1976.

item.title: イギリスのコメディアン、ジョー・ライセットが、メール紙、サン紙、BBCニュース、ITVニュース、スカイニュース、インディペンデント紙など、イギリスのメディアに4つのフェイク記事を仕掛けたことを公表（Nadeem Badshah/The Guardian）
item.description:
Nadeem Badshah / The Guardian:
UK comedian Joe Lycett discloses that he planted four fake stories in the UK media, including the Mail, the Sun, BBC News, ITV News, Sky News, and Independent  —  Stories include man with bruise in shape of Prince Harry and statue of H from Steps being erected in Wales

item.title: [スレッド】NPRの偏向に関するウリ・ベルリナーのエッセイには、検証可能な虚偽、欠陥のある議論、疑わしい有権者登録データなど、重大な問題がある（Aaron Fritschner/@fritschner）
item.description:
Aaron Fritschner / @fritschner:
[Thread] Uri Berliner's essay on NPR bias has significant problems, including verifiable falsehoods, flawed arguments, and questionable voter registration data  —  Finally read the Uri Berliner piece on NPR biasand I'm baffled by how little the enormous media controversy it spawned has resulted in scrutiny of its claims for factual accuracy. There are significant problems with the piece including obvious, verifiable falsehoods

item.title: 情報筋：元Disney TVチーフ、ベン・シャーウッド氏と元Hearst Magazines幹部ジョアンナ・コールズ氏がデイリービーストの株式49％を購入、バリー・ディラー氏は51％を保持（Dylan Byers/@dylanbyers）
item.description:
Dylan Byers / @dylanbyers:
Sources: former Disney TV chief Ben Sherwood and former Hearst Magazines exec Joanna Coles will buy a 49% stake in The Daily Beast; Barry Diller will retain 51%  —  SCOOP Pt. 2 @PuckNews: Ben Sherwood and Joanna Coles will buy 49% stake of The Daily Beast, I'm told... Barry Diller will retain majority 51% stake... Sherwood & Coles giving interview to @nytimes this weekend ahead of formal announcement

item.title: 米連邦検察当局は、ティム・バークにフォックス・ニュースなどが使用するシステムへのアクセス資格を与えたとされるマルコ・ガウディーノを共謀罪1件で起訴（マシュー・キーズ／デスク）
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
Federal prosecutors charge Marco Gaudino with one count of conspiracy for allegedly giving Tim Burke credentials to access systems used by Fox News and others  —  A Washington state man has been criminally charged for allegedly conspiring with a Florida journalist to compromise online-based servers …

Sherwood News:
Twitch has become a major Spanish-language platform, with streamers like TheGrefg and Ibai Llanos hosting live sporting events that attract massive audiences  —  Spanish streamers are redefining Twitch's relationship to traditional media.  —  One of the most interesting stories our data …
